meanings.definition: The state of being dissipated or dispersed.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the dissipatednesses of the confetti on the floor was evident.
meanings.sent2: The dissipatednesses of the clouds signaled an upcoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The dissipatednesses of the bubbles in the fizzy drink made it fun to watch.
meanings.sent4: The dissipatednesses of the crowd after the concert left the venue empty.
meanings.sent5: The dissipatednesses of the scent lingered in the room long after the candle was blown out.

meanings.definition: The quality of being wasteful or extravagant.
meanings.sent1: Her dissipatednesses with money led to financial troubles.
meanings.sent2: The dissipatednesses of the decorations at the event were impressive but costly.
meanings.sent3: His dissipatednesses with snacks always left the pantry empty.
meanings.sent4: The dissipatednesses of the feast left everyone feeling satisfied but guilty.
meanings.sent5: The dissipatednesses of the fireworks display was a sight to behold, but it burned a hole in the budget.

meanings.definition: The act of indulging in excessive pleasure or vice.
meanings.sent1: Her dissipatednesses in shopping always resulted in a full closet.
meanings.sent2: The dissipatednesses of his late-night parties worried his friends.
meanings.sent3: Their dissipatednesses in playing video games all day made them forget about homework.
meanings.sent4: The dissipatednesses of his love for chocolate knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The dissipatednesses of her laughter filled the room with joy and mischief.
